violation: Unsafe speed for conditions (Basic Speed Law)
law_text: No person shall drive a vehicle upon a highway at a speed greater than is reasonable or prudent having due regard for weather, visibility, traffic, and surface conditions.
preventive_tip: Even if the limit is 65, slow down if it's raining or foggy.
rule_summary: Speed must be reasonable for current conditions, regardless of posted limit.

law_text: No person shall drive a vehicle on strictly preferential use lanes (carpool) unless that vehicle carries the requisite number of occupants.
preventive_tip: Check the diamond lane signs; hours and occupancy rules vary.
rule_summary: Solo drivers cannot use HOV lanes during active hours.

law_text: A person shall not drive a motor vehicle while holding and operating a handheld wireless telephone or an electronic wireless communications device.
penalty: $20 base fine (1st offense), but fees make it ~$160+
preventive_tip: Mount your phone on the dash; holding it is illegal even at stoplights.
rule_summary: Holding a phone while driving is prohibited.
